JW

Tiny Stay

Previous Next

A 3 person team project practicing brownfield development. We were given a codebase for a tool rental store, and pivoted it into a mutlitenancy airbnb clone themed around tiny homes. Users can list their own homes on the site, upload multiple images, and make reservations on the site. Some of the challenges were working with geocoding to enable searching homes based on address, city, state, or zip. Google maps integration. And using a jquery datepicker that greys out dates based on previous reservations.

Learning Focus:

Brownfield Development Multitenancy Geocoding jQuery

Github Heroku

Which Twitch

Previous Next

A short solo project recreating parts www.twitch.tv using their api. Users can log in with their twitch account, view live streams by game, view their followed streams, and follow or unfollow streams.

Learning Focus:

Consuming API Testing External API with VCR OAuth

Github Heroku

Rails Engine

A short solo project recreating the previous project black thursday as a API. Project reads sales data in from CSV's and provides access to that data and business intelligence about that data through an API interface

Learning Focus:

Building an API Testing API with request specs Active Record Queries

Github

Digital Destination

Previous Next

A three person team project implementing an ecommerce site in Ruby on Rails. Admins can create items or categories, and manage user orders. Admins can upload product images and digital goods to an AWS s3 server using paperclip. Users can create accounts or login with Github OAuth, add items to their cart, and checkout. When an admin marks a user purchased order as completed, Active mailer emails the user with a download link for the digital product they purchased.

Learning Focus:

Rails Authentication Authorization OAuth S3 with Paperclip Active Mailer

Github Heroku

Rush Hour

Previous Next

A pair project where we implemented a very basic google analytics clone in sinatra with active record. The site would recieve a payload of data about a visit to a site, parse that data and then store it in the database. Active record then provides business intelligence about that data.

Learning Focus:

Sinatra Active Record Authorization

Github

Robot World

Previous Next

A solo project to implement my first database driven web application. Robot World is a sinatra app that hosts a repository of robots using an sqlite 3 database and the Sequel ORM for ruby. Users can perform basic CRUD functionality for a collection of robots.

Learning Focus:

Sinatra Web App basics SQL

Github

Black Thursday

A pair project where a partner and I implemented a rudimentary form of active record in ruby, before we knew what active record was. The project pulls in large amounts of data from CSV files and maps them to ruby objects, establishes relationships between them, and performs business intelligence queries on the object.

Learning Focus:

Relational Database Design Project Organization and Management OOP Principles

Github

HTTP Server

A pair project where we implemented an http server in ruby using the ruby http library. Users can play a number guessing game or look up the definitions of words.

Learning Focus:

Web basics HTTP Requests HTTP Responses

Github

Battleship

A solo project where I implemented a command line repl version of battleship. Players can play a game of battleship against a cpu on a 4x4 grid. This was an early ruby project where the focus was on making clean well organized code in one of my first larger projects.

Learning Focus:

REPL Interface Project Organization OOP Principles
